Usain Bolt, a Jamaican sprinter and six-time Olympic gold medalist, will participate in the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas in May 2023. He will be competing as part of the Jamaican team for the relay championship, and will run on May 2 and 3. Bolt is excited to be a part of the Jamaican team and represent his country in this event.

The six-time Olympic gold medalist will be competing at the championship on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt's return to the track has generated significant excitement among athletics fans, who are eager to witness the legendary sprinter in action one more time.
